Svayambhu

Digital Critical Edition and Translation of an Old Javanese Juridical Text

Edited by Arlo Griffiths & Timothy Lubin

  • Witnesses
  • Metadata

List of Witnesses

  • L: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, the Netherlands, Or. 4530: Balinese script on paper, van der Tuuk collection; typed Roman transcript: Leiden BCB portfolio 165
  • K: Kirtya, Singaraja, Bali, Indonesia, 774 (kropak 3) II A/3/774: Balinese script on lontar; typed Roman transcript: HKS 1883 = Leiden Or. 15.027
  • M: Kirtya, Singaraja, Bali, Indonesia, 280 (kropak 3) II A/3/280: Balinese script on lontar; typed Roman transcript: HKS 3046 = Leiden Or. 16.190
  • SvaMSS: The Sanskrit text as implied by the Svayambhu manuscripts
  • EdO : Olivelle, Patrick. 2005. Manu’s Code of Law: A Critical Edition and Translation of the Mānava-Dharmásāstra. New York: Oxford University Press.

Metadata of the Edition

  • Title: Svayambhu. Digital Critical Edition and Translation of an Old Javanese Juridical Text
  • Text Identifier: DHARMA_CritEdSvayambhu

invocation

L:1K:1vM:1vavighnam astu.

1.

Account of Dharma

1.

vyavahārān didr̥kṣus tu brāhmaṇaiḥ saha pārthivaḥ | mantrajñair mantribhiś caiva vinītaḥ praviśet sabhām ||
  • MDhŚ08.001

1.1

kunaṅ ulaha saṅ prabhu, uniṅānira taṅ vyavahāranikaṅ rāt, arovaṅa ta sira brāhmaṇa vihikan(1) maṅaji, lavan mantri vruh(2) maviveka(3), sulakṣaṇaha ta sira tumamaha riṅ sabhā.

2.

tatrāsīnaḥ sthito vāpi pāṇim udyamya dakṣiṇam | vinītaveṣābharaṇaḥ paśyet kāryāṇi kāryiṇām ||
  • MDhŚ08.002

2.1

aliṅgihāpagəha(4) ta sira riṅ sabhā, taṅanira tṅən atah ulahaknira, hayvātuduh-tuduh*(5) kiva(6), bhūṣaṇa-pahyasniṅ vvaṅ suśīlātah(7) lviranira, iṅət-iṅətənirātah yogyāyogyani(8) kāryanikaṅ mavyavahāra kalih.

3.

pratyahaṁ deśadr̥ṣṭaiś ca śāstradr̥ṣṭaiś ca hetubhiḥ | aṣṭādaśasu mārgeṣu nibaddhāni pr̥thak pr̥thak ||
  • MDhŚ08.003

3.1

*sari masiha(9) sirān ṅiṅət-iṅəta makasādhanaṅ(10) varah-varah(11) saṅ hyaṅ āgama mānavādi(12), mvaṅ sakinapagəhaknikaṅ sapañjiṅ(13) deśanya, deśa ṅaranya,(14) sakaḍaṅayan(15), sajasun(16)vuṅkal, savuravan(17), sakanuruhan, an(18) hana *kaparəkanya deniṅ āgama, ya ika(19) deśadr̥ṣṭa ṅaranya, an tan(20) deśa sasiki svadeśanikaṅ mavyavahāra(21), aṣṭādaśasu mārgeṣu(22), irikā sthānaniṅ vyavahāra vvalu(23) vlas kvehnya, salviraniṅ vicāraniṅ(24) vyavahāra, hana tinmunya ṅkāna salah siki, paḍa madudva-dudvan(25) viṣayanya.

4.

hiṁsāṁ yaḥ kurute kaś cid deyaṁ vā na prayacchati | sthāne te dve vivādasya bhinno ’ṣṭādaśadhā punaḥ ||
  • This stanza is absent from Olivelle 2005’s constituted text, though it is referenced in his app. crit. for one manuscript. The stanza occurs in ed. Mandlik 1886 8.4 with reading bhinno, where the Svayambhu implies bhinne.

4.1

hiṁsāṁ yaḥ(26) kurute kaś cit, hana vvaṅ mamatyani nirdoṣa, kunaṅ(27) deyam vā(28) na prayacchati(29), tan paveh irikaṅ yogya vehakna(30), aveh irikaṅ tan yogya vehaknanya kunaṅ, sthāne(31) te dve vivādasya(32), ya ika(33) sthānaniṅ vyavahāra, rvaṅ siki mūlanya(34), bhinne(35) ’ṣṭādaśadhā(36) punaḥ, matmahan ta ya vvalu vlas vkasan.

5.

teṣām ādyam r̥ṇādānaṁ nikṣepo ’svāmivikrayaḥ | saṁbhūya ca samutthānaṁ dattasyānapakarma ca ||
  • MDhŚ08.004

vetanasyaiva cādānaṁ(37) saṁvidaś ca vyatikramaḥ | krayavikrayānuśayo vivādaḥ svāmipālayoḥ ||
  • MDhŚ08.005

sīmāvivādadharmaś ca pāruṣye daṇḍavācike | steyaṁ ca sāhasaṁ caiva strīsaṁgrahaṇam eva ca ||
  • MDhŚ08.006

strīpuṁdharmo vibhāgaś ca dyūtam āhvaya(38) eva ca | padāny aṣṭādaśaitāni vyavahārasthitāv iha(39) ||
  • MDhŚ08.007

5.1

lvirnya, teṣām ādyam(40) r̥ṇādānam(41), tan kasahuraniṅ hutaṅ(42), ādiniṅ vyavahāra. nikṣepa, tan kavehaniṅ patuvava(43). asvāmi(44)vikraya(45), adval tan dravya. sambhūya ca(46) samutthānam(47), tan kaduman ulihiṅ kinabehan. dattasyānapakarma(48) ca, *karuddhāniṅ(49) huvus vinehakən.

5.2

vetanasya(51)na cadānam(52)(50), tan kavehaniṅ(53) upahan. samvidaś ca vyatikramaḥ, advā riṅ samaya. krayavikrayānuśayo(54), alarāmbəknyān(55) padvalnya,(56) pamlinya kunaṅ. vivādaḥ svāmipālayoḥ(57), vivādaniṅ(58) *pinaṅvanakən mvaṅ maṅvan.

5.3

sīmāvivādadharmaś ca, kaücapaniṅ vatəs. pāruṣye daṇḍavācike, ḍaṇḍaniṅ sāhasa(59), vākpāruṣya. steyam(60), pavr̥ttiniṅ maliṅ. sāhasam, ulah sāhasa. strīsaṁgrahaṇam eva ca(61), ulah tan yogya riṅ strī, strīpuṁdharmo, dharmaniṅ laki-strī.

5.4

vibhāgaś(62) ca, kadumaniṅ dravya. dyūtam(63), totohan tan(64) prāṇi. āhvānam(65), totohan prāṇi. padāny(66) aṣṭādaśaitāni, nahan ta vvalu(67) vlas lvirnya. vyavahārasthitāni ha(68), byakta pinakasthānaniṅ(69) vyavahāra.

6.

eṣu sthāneṣu bhūyiṣṭhaṁ vivādaṁ caratāṁ nr̥ṇām | dharmaṁ śāśvatam āśritya kuryāt kāryavinirṇayam ||
  • MDhŚ08.008

6.1

eṣu(70) sthāneṣu(71) bhūyiṣṭham(72), ikaṅ vyavahāra(73)sthāna vvalu(74) vlas, kapva hana katmunya ṅkāna(75), kapagəhakna(76) saṅ prabhu, yuktinikaṅ vyavahāranya, apan gavayaknanira pagəh i(77) kāryanikaṅ(78) yogya pagəhaknanira.

7.

yadā svayaṁ na kuryāt tu nr̥patiḥ kāryadarśanam | tadā niyuñjyād vidvāṁsaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ kāryadarśane ||
  • MDhŚ08.009

7.1

kunaṅ saṅ prabhu hayva sira gumavayakən(79) ikaṅ kāryāmivakṣa(80) guṇadoṣa, akona ta sira ri(81) saṅ brāhmaṇa(82) vihikan maṅaji(83), kumavruhana yogyāyogya(84)nikaṅ vvaṅ mavyavahāra kalih.

8.

aṣṭādaśapadābhijñaṁ prāḍvivāketi saṁjñitam | ānvīkṣikyāṁ ca kuśalaṁ śrutismr̥tiparāyaṇam ||
  • This stanza is absent from the constituted text in Olivelle 2005, though it is referenced in his app. crit. for ms. Ox2 after 8.9. Mandlik (p. 877) and Jha include the stanza at the beginning of Medhātithi’s comment on 8.9; in his notes, Jha (v. 9, p. 490) cites citations of this verse in medieval scholastic works. In contrast with the cases in Div. XX and YY, van Naerssen (van Naerssen 1956) did not notice that the Old Javanese text here implies the presence of this stanza because the Sanskrit original is not quoted.

8.1

saṅ brāhmaṇa saṅ vruh riṅ aṣṭādaśavyavahāra,(85) sira ta(86) saṅ sinaṅguh prāgvivāka(87), saṅ vruh riṅ aji tarka, vruh(88) riṅ śruti(89) veda.

9.

vivāde pr̥cchati praśnaṁ pratipraśnaṁ tathaiva ca | priyapūrvaṁ prāg vadati prāḍvivākas tataḥ smr̥taḥ ||
  • Brh_1,1.69 This stanza is present neither in the constituted text of Olivelle 2005, nor in its app. crit., but is known to have occurred in the Br̥haspatismr̥ti, a text often cited by medieval Indian dharmaśāstra authors. The Old Javanese paraphrase suggests that its author knew the Sanskrit stanza with a reading vicāre for vivāde.

9.1

kunaṅ ikaṅ takvan iṅ(90) vicāra, gavayakna rumuhun, sādhana saṅ prāgvivāka irikaṅ(91) mavyavahāra kalih, vivekanira ta sahurnya vkasan, mataṅyan(92) prāgvivāka(93) pva ṅaranira.

10.

so ’sya kāryāṇi saṁpaśyet sabhyair eva tribhir vr̥taḥ | sabhām eva praviśyāgryām āsīnaḥ sthita eva vā ||
  • MDhŚ08.010

10.1

aṅiṅət-iṅəta ta(94) saṅ prāgvivāka(95), i kāryanikaṅ(96) mavyavahāra kalih, arovaṅa ta(97) sira vvaṅ yogya riṅ sabhā(98) tigaṅ viji, tumamaä(99) ta sirāluṅguhāpagəha(100) riṅ sabhā.

11.

yasmin deśe niṣīdanti viprā vedavidas trayaḥ | rājñaś ca prakr̥to vidvān brāhmaṇas tāṁ sabhāṁ viduḥ ||
  • MDhŚ08.011

11.1

saṅ brāhmaṇa tigaṅ siki(101), paḍa vruh maṅaji, hana brāhmaṇa(102) sasiki prajñān(103) vidagdha, vinidhi muṅgva riṅ deśa saṅ prabhu, ikaṅ deśa papupulanira, yeka deśa sabhā ṅaranya de saṅ paṇḍita(104).

12.

na sā sabhā yatra na santi vr̥ddhā vr̥ddhā na te ye na vadanti dharmam | nāsau dharmo yatra na satyam asti na tat satyaṁ yac chalenānuviddham ||
  • NarSm mā. 3.17/NMS vya. 80
  • MDhŚ08.012 dharmo viddhas tv adharmeṇa sabhāṁ yatropatiṣṭhate | śalyaṁ cāsya na kr̥ntanti viddhās tatra sabhāsadaḥ ||

12.1

ikaṅ sabhā(105), yan tan hana saṅ vr̥ddhah tan sabhā ṅaranya, saṅ vr̥ddhah yan tan vruh iṅ(107) dharma, tan vr̥ddhah ṅaranira,(106) saṅ vruh iṅ(108) dharma yan tan agəgvana(109) kasatyan(110), tan dharma ṅaranikā, kunaṅ yan tan ginavayakən(111) ikaṅ dharma riṅ sabhā, sukət paṅəməh ṅaranikā sahaneṅ(112) sabhā, mapan(113) ikaṅ deśa kinahananiṅ dharma, tan kavoraniṅ(114) adharmi, yeka sabhā ṅaranya.

13.

sabhā vā na praveṣṭavyā vaktavyaṁ vā samañjasam | abruvan vibruvan vāpi naro bhavati kilbiṣī ||
  • MDhŚ08.013

13.1

kunaṅ ikaṅ vvaṅ aṅujarakən prāya yukti, salah denya vkasan, makveh ujarnya, vvaṅ katon doṣanya(115), ika(116) ta kabeh tan yogya tumamaä riṅ sabhā.

14.

yatra dharmo hy adharmeṇa satyaṁ yatrānr̥tena ca | hanyate prekṣamāṇānāṁ hatās tatra sabhāsadaḥ ||
  • MDhŚ08.014

14.1

mataṅyan maṅkana, dharmanika saṅ uniṅa riṅ dharma, hilaṅ ika deniṅ adharma riṅ sabhā, kasatyanira(117) maṅkanātah hilaṅ ikā(118) deniṅ adva riṅ sabhā, yapvan alah juga dharma deniṅ adharma, alah juga satya deniṅ adva, paḍa hana(119) pva ya riṅ sabhā, patimbunaniṅ(120) kuṇapa ṅaraniṅ sabhā yan maṅkana.

15.

dharma eva hato hanti dharmo rakṣati rakṣitaḥ | tasmād dharmo na hantavyo mā no dharmo hato ’vadhīt ||
  • MDhŚ08.015

15.1

kunaṅ yan iṅilaṅakən saṅ hyaṅ dharma, maləs juga sira maṅilaṅakən, yan rinakṣa saṅ hyaṅ dharma, maləs juga sira maṅrakṣa(121), mataṅyan(122) maṅkana, hayvāṅilaṅakən dharma, liṅniṅ vvaṅ, tan paṅilaṅakən pva kita(123) dharma, tan paṅilaṅakən sira iri ya, maṅkana(124) liṅ ...,(125) atəhər pramāṇastava(126).

16.

  • unknown

16.1

apan(127) tan hana ləviha sakeṅ dharma, sira pinakapramāṇaniṅ(128) loka, sira(129) ta pinakasvarga saṅ magave(131) hayu, sira pinakakaləpasan saṅ paṇḍita, tan maṅkana ikaṅ vvaṅ adharma, tan hana gamāntyanya(132) maṅkanāta saṅka pisana tuvi.

17.

  • unknown

17.1

mapan ikaṅ loka kabeh, dharma umagəhakən(133) ika, kinapagəhakən pva sira de saṅ(134) yatna, maləs sira magəhakən, apan tan pāpa ikaṅ(135) loka maṅkana(136), ikaṅ tan aṅilaṅakən dharma.

18.

vr̥ṣo hi bhagavān dharmas tasya yaḥ kurute tv alam | vr̥ṣalaṁ taṁ vidur devās tasmād dharmaṁ na lopayet ||
  • MDhŚ08.016

18.1

mataṅyan(137) maṅkana, ləmbu rūpa bhaṭāra(138) dharma, hana pva vvaṅ(139) tan(140) agave dharma, yeka pāpa liṅniṅ deva, maṅkana pva ya, hayva kita maṅilaṅakən dharma.

19.

eka eva suhr̥d dharmo nidhāne ’py anuyāti yaḥ | śarīreṇa samaṁ nāśaṁ sarvam anyad dhi gacchati ||
  • MDhŚ08.017

19.1

saṅ(141) tumut ri kālaniṅ pati(142) sira ta bhaṭāra dharma, mitra tan pakarva pva, parəṅ ilaṅ mvaṅ śarīra, mvaṅ dharma, kunaṅ hikaṅ dr̥vya len sakerika, salah paran ika.

20.

pādo ’dharmasya kartāraṁ pādaḥ sākṣiṇam r̥cchati | pādaḥ sabhāsadaḥ sarvān pādo rājānam r̥cchati ||
  • MDhŚ08.018

20.1

saṅ hyaṅ dharma saparapatan(143) tinəmuniṅ mavyavahāra yan satya, maṅkana hikaṅ sākṣi yan satya, anmu saparapatanira(144) saṅ hyaṅ(145) dharma, maṅkana saṅ mavivakṣa kabeh, yan satya anəmu saparapatanira saṅ hyaṅ dharmātah, saṅ prabhu anəmu saparapatanirātah, agəṅ juga phalaniṅ kasatyan ginavayakən(146).

21.

rājā bhavaty anenās tu mucyante ca sabhāsadaḥ | eno gacchati kartāraṁ nindārho yatra nindyate ||
  • MDhŚ08.019

21.1

saṅ prabhu tan kahanan sira riṅ(147) pāpa, saṅ mavivakṣa kabeh luput sira riṅ pāpa, ikaṅ mavyavahāra salah pakṣanya juga təmpuhanya, nininda siṅ(148) saṅkananya, kahava tkeṅ(149) deśa kahananya.

22.

jātimātropajīvī vā kāmaṁ syād brāhmaṇabruvaḥ | dharmapravaktā nr̥pater na tu śūdraḥ kathaṁ cana ||
  • MDhŚ08.020 Our text gives no paraprahse for the first stanza grouped in this section.

yasya śūdras tu kurute rājño dharmavivecanam | tasya sīdati tad rāṣṭraṁ paṅke gaur iva paśyataḥ ||
  • MDhŚ08.021

22.1

maṅkana saṅ prabhu, yan śūdra prāgvivākanira(150), kaḍatvanira durbala(151) kṣaya, kadi ləmbu kaptək riṅ(152) latək ajro.

  • Bhismaparva The last sentence has a parallel in Bhīṣmaparva 124.19:kadi ləmbu kapətək iṅ latək.

23.

yad rāṣṭraṁ śūdrabhūyiṣṭhaṁ nāstikākrāntam advijam | vinaśyaty āśu tat kr̥tsnaṁ durbhikṣavyādhipīḍitam ||
  • MDhŚ08.022

23.1

ikaṅ rājya, yan kakehaniṅ(153) śūdra, akveh vvaṅ(154) manayākən deva iriya, tan pabrāhmaṇa, ikaṅ rājya maṅkana, śīghra hilaṅ deniṅ lapā(155) vyādhi bhaya kaḍatvanira.

24.

  • unknown vyavahārān svayaṁ paśyet sabhyaiḥ parivr̥to ’nvaham || YDh 1.360 = BṛhSm 1.1.106]

24.1

maṅkana pva ya, maṅutusa ta sirāmivakṣaha*, vvaṅ vruh iṅ āgama, śīghra maṅucapa yan tinakvanan, saṅ makveh kavruhnira(156) śruti veda, paḍaməlakna vataṅan pāt, ikaṅ vet an pamivakṣana*, sakveh saṅ humuṅguh(157) irika, sira ta(158) paḍa umiṅət-iṅəta sarasaniṅ vyavahāra.

25.

dharmāsanam adhiṣṭhāya saṁvītāṅgaḥ samāhitaḥ | praṇamya lokapālebhyaḥ kāryadarśanam ārabhet ||
  • MDhŚ08.023

25.1

maṅkanānakna(159) sajiniṅ vataṅan, apuy riṅ payajñan(160), kumbha mesya bañu, halalaṅ, sarvavīja,(161) maṇik curiga muṅgva riṅ səṇḍi. tumama pva saṅ prāgvivāka riṅ sabhā, mavḍihana, asalimputa(162), maṅañjaliha riṅ caturlokapāla, lumkasa ta sira maṅiṅət-iṅəta kāryanikaṅ mavyavahāra kalih.

26.

arthānarthāv ubhau buddhvā dharmādharmau ca kevalau | varṇakrameṇa sarvāṇi paśyet kāryāṇi kāryiṇām ||
  • MDhŚ08.025

26.1

kavruhananira kaṅ ujar adon lavan tan padon, mvaṅ ikaṅ(163) tuhu lavan adva, nahan ta kāryanikaṅ vyavahāra kalih, iniṅət-iṅətənira, tumutana kramaniṅ varṇanikaṅ vyavahāra.

27.

bāhyair vibhāvayel liṅgair bhāvam antargataṁ nr̥ṇām | svaravarṇeṅgitākāraiś cakṣuṣā ceṣṭitena ca ||
  • MDhŚ08.025

27.1

adharma(164)buddhinikaṅ vyavahāra, iṅətakənanya(165) tuvi, kavruhana de saṅ prāgvivāka, vāhyaliṅgaiḥ(166), makanimitta(167) *paṅanumāna(168) katon, śabdanya kasalahan, kavnəsan, heṅas(169) tan asiga ri(170) vkasan, mulat(171) muliṅā, sahulah(172) alaṅə̄(173).

28.

ākārair iṅgitair gatyā ceṣṭayā bhāṣitena ca | netravaktravikāraiś ca gr̥hyate ’ntargataṁ manaḥ ||
  • MDhŚ08.026

28.1

takvanikaṅ manah, halit pinakabuṅkahiṅ buddhi, yadyapi(174) hinə-həttakənya(175) hinət-ətakənya(176) denikaṅ avyavahāra, yan adharma, kavruhana hikā de saṅ prāgvivāka, makanimitta(177) vāhyaliṅga(178). ākāraiḥ(179), iṅgitaiḥ(180), lakunya, ulahnya, śabdanya, vikāraniṅ hulatnya, vnəsniṅ mukanya.

colophon

iti dharmacarita(181).

2.

Protection of Faithful Women

29.

bāladāyādikaṁ rikthaṁ tāvad rājānupālayet | yāvat sa syāt samāvr̥tto yāvad vātītaśaiśavaḥ ||
  • MDhŚ08.027 Our mss. suggest a variant reading yāvat na syāt, i.e., yāvan na syāt, in pāda c.

29.1

kunaṅ dr̥vya kaliliraniṅ(182) rare *tuvu-tuvuh(183), kəmitən kəkəsana saṅ prabhu, ikaṅ dr̥vya, yan apa maṅkana, yāvan na(184) syāt samāvr̥tto(185), yan tan uvus(186) maṅaji, ya(187) tapvan vnaṅ rumakṣa dr̥vyanya, kunaṅ yan uvus mulih sakiṅ gurunya, vnaṅ rumakṣa dr̥vyanya, vehakna ikaṅ dr̥vya iriya.

30.

vaśāputrāsu caivaṁ syād rakṣaṇaṁ niṣkulāsu ca | pativratāsu ca strīṣu vidhavāsv āturāsu ca ||
  • MDhŚ08.028

30.1

strī valva-valvan mānak raray rakṣanən(188) ikā de saṅ prabhu, strī valu(189) tan pabapebu(190), strī valu vyādhi, *makapaṅguhan(191) satyanya riṅ jalunya, ika ta katiga rakṣanən de saṅ prabhu, sira haṅilaṅakna yan ana vvaṅ avamāna(192) hiriya, mataṅhyan maṅkana, ika kasatyan haneriya, pāvak bhaṭāra dharma katvaṅananira(193), kunaṅ yan satya ikaṅ strī, hayva(194) saṅ prabhu parabyāpāra irikā kabeh.

31.

jīvantīnāṁ tu tāsāṁ ye tad dhareyuḥ svabāndhavāḥ | tāñ chiṣyāc cauradaṇḍena dhārmikaḥ pr̥thivīpatiḥ ||
  • MDhŚ08.029

31.1

yapvan ana kadaṅnikaṅ(195) strī valu satya sḍaṅnyan ahurip, umalapa dr̥vyanya, ḍaṇdan ikaṅ(196) aṅalap(197) de saṅ prabhu, sadaṇḍaniṅ maliṅ ḍaṇḍanya(198).

colophon

iti strīsatyarakṣaṇa.

3.

Account of Established Norms

32.

pranaṣṭasvāmikaṁ rikthaṁ rājā tryabdaṁ nidhāpayet | arvāk tryabdād dharet svāmī pareṇa nr̥patir haret ||
  • MDhŚ08.030

32.1

kunaṅ hikaṅ dr̥vya tan ana saṅ madr̥vya, kəkəsana de saṅ prabhu, ikaṅ dr̥vya maṅkana, tluṅ tahun lavasanya(199), yapvan tka(200) tikaṅ madr̥vya, haminta i sira vehakna hikaṅ dr̥vya de saṅ prabhu, yapvan alivat sakeṅ(201) tigaṅ tahun, alapən tikaṅ(202) dr̥vya de saṅ prabhu.

33.

mamedam iti yo brūyāt so ’nuyojyo yathāvidhi | saṁvādya rūpasaṁkhyādīn svāmī tad dravyam arhati ||

33.1

dr̥vyaṅku iki liṅnya, saṅ(203) maṅaku dr̥vya(204), ikaṅ(205) maṅkana, takvanana ya irikaṅ dr̥vya hinakunya, vruh pva ye rūpanya siṅgih ika dr̥vyanya,(206) vehakna hiriya.

34.

avedayan pranaṣṭasya deśaṁ kālaṁ ca tattvataḥ | varṇaṁ rūpaṁ pramāṇaṁ ca tatsamaṁ daṇḍam arhati ||

hana tan avruh ri kahilaṅaniṅ(207) dr̥vyanya, kālanya, nimittanya hilaṅ, varṇanya, rūpanya, kvehnya, kapva hikā tan ana kinavruhanya(208), kevalya(209) maṅaku dr̥vya, juga ya,(210) ikā ta vvaṅ maṅkana, yogya ḍaṇḍan ikā(211), samūlyanikaṅ dr̥vya hinakunya ḍaṇḍahanya.

35.

ādadītātha ṣaḍbhāgaṁ pranaṣṭādhigatān nr̥paḥ | daśamaṁ dvādaśaṁ vāpi satāṁ dharmam anusmaran ||

36.

pranaṣṭādhigataṁ dravyaṁ tiṣṭhed yuktair adhiṣṭhitam | yāṁs tatra caurān gr̥hṇīyāt tān rājebhena ghātayet ||
  • MDhŚ08.034

37.

mamāyam iti yo brūyān nidhiṁ satyena mānavaḥ | tasyādadīta ṣaḍbhāgaṁ rājā dvādaśam eva vā ||
  • MDhŚ08.035

37.1

kunaṅ ikaṅ dr̥vya halavas pinəṇḍəm, dr̥vyaṅku iki liṅnya, pan tuhu dr̥vyanya, tan(217) kinəmit saṅ prabhu ikā, yadyapin maṅkana, maṅkana de saṅ prabhu, sapanəmanikaṅ(218) dr̥vya, sapararva-vlasanya, kunəṅ halapən anya.

38.

anr̥taṁ tu vadan daṇḍyaḥ svavittasyāṁśam aṣṭamam | tasyaiva vā nidhānasya saṁkhyayālpīyasīṁ kalām ||

39.

vidvāṁs tu brāhmaṇo dr̥ṣṭvā pūrvopanihitaṁ nidhim | aśeṣato ’py ādadīta sarvasyādhipatir hi saḥ ||
  • MDhŚ08.037

39.1

40.

yaṁ tu paśyen nidhiṁ rājā purāṇaṁ nihitaṁ kṣitau | tasmād dvijebhyo dattvārdham ardhaṁ kośe praveśayet ||

41.

nidhīnāṁ hi purāṇānāṁ dhātūnām eva ca kṣitau | ardhabhāg rakṣaṇād rājā bhūmer adhipatir hi saḥ ||

42.

dātavyaṁ sarvavarṇebhyo rājñā caurair hr̥taṁ dhanam | rājā tad upayuñjānaś caurasyāpnoti kilbiṣam ||
  • MDhŚ08.040

42.1

43.

jātijānapadān dharmān śreṇīdharmāṁś ca dharmavit | samīkṣya kuladharmāṁś ca svadharmaṁ pratipādayet ||

ulah kinapagəhakniṅ(231) janma(232), mvaṅ kinapagəhakniṅ(233) tani(234) janapada, kinapagəhakniṅ baṇyaga(235) kunəṅ, kinapagəhakniṅ kavatəkanya, kunaṅ ika ta kabeh kapagəhakna de saṅ prabhu, yan(236) ri svadharmanya, rumakṣa ri svadharmanira yan maṅkana.

44.

45.1

  • MDhŚ08.044

46.1

kadyaṅganikaṅ tuha(243) buru, tumut ikaṅ buron kna panah denya, titisniṅ rahnya(244) paṅavruhanya riṅ paranya, maṅkanāta saṅ prabhu, kumavruhana ta dva-tuhunikaṅ(245) vyavahāra kālih, makanimitta *paṅanumāna vāhyaliṅgādi(246).

47.

satyam arthaṁ ca saṁpaśyed ātmānam atha sākṣiṇaḥ | deśaṁ kālaṁ ca rūpaṁ ca vyavahāravidhau sthitaḥ ||

dharmeṇa vyavahāreṇa chalenācaritena ca | prayuktaṁ sādhayed arthaṁ pañcamena balena ca ||

tagihən, asih-asihən(261), konən manahura, kapiṅro, taṅtaṅən mavyavahāra(262), kapiṅtiga, hadānā sisilihan, kapiṅpat, dānana tuṅgal,(263) maṅkana upāyaniṁ sumādhya pihutaṅnya(264) mijila, tan kavnaṅ pva ya ikaṅ mahutaṅ deniṅ upāya pat, lakvakna ta kapiṅlimaniṅ upāya, valātkāran, irən huluna.

52.

yaḥ svayaṁ sādhayed artham uttamarṇo ’dhamarṇikāt | na sa rājñābhiyoktavyaḥ svakaṁ saṁsādhayan dhanam ||

arthe ’pavyayamānaṁ tu karaṇena vibhāvitam | dāpayed dhanikasyārthaṁ daṇḍaleśaṁ ca śaktitaḥ ||

53.1

54.

r̥ṇe deye pratijñāte pañcakaṁ śatam arhati | apahnave tu dviguṇaṁ tan manor anuśāsanam ||

ikaṅ hutaṅ sinamayakən sahurənya denikaṅ ahutaṅ, ri tka samaya(274) pva tan sinahuranya, yogya ḍaṇḍan ikaṅ vvaṅ maṅkana, ḍaṇḍa pañcaśata(275) paṇa, tumutana(276) satus paṇa, mā, 10, mā, 2(277), yan samaṅkana hutaṅniṅ mithyanya(278), kunaṅ yan paṅas(279) tan pasamayānahura liṅnya, katəpətan(280) deniṅ sākṣi mvaṅ tulis, ləpihakna hikaṅ pañcaśata(281) paṇa, ku, 2, su, 3, mā, 2(282), riṅ satus *paṅḍaṇḍeriya, maṅkana śāsana(283) bhaṭāra manu.

(284)

apahnave ’dhamarṇasya dehīty uktasya saṁsadi | abhiyoktā diśed deśaṁ karaṇaṁ vānyad uddiśet ||

yatra na syāt kr̥taṁ pattraṁ karaṇaṁ ca na vidyate | na copalambhaḥ pūrvoktas tatra daivī kriyā bhavet ||
  • Olivelle’s ms. La1 interpolates this stanza after 8.52; Mandlik records it in brackets after 8.51 (likewise KSS and Dave). Medhātithi cites it in his commentary on 8.51 as an illustrative quotation with the words “thus they say” (tathāhuḥ), and with the reading pūrvokto daivī tatra.

56.1

yan tan ana patranikaṅ anagih, sādhananiṅ hanagih(290) tan anātah, tan ana putra *kalāntara, tan anāmituturi, samāsatyaha juga ya, bhaṭāra kumavruha(291) dva-tuhunya.

adeśaṁ yaś ca diśati nirdiśyāpahnute ca yaḥ | yaś cādharottarān arthān vigītān nāvabudhyate ||

apadiśyāpadeśyaṁ ca punar yas tv apadhāvati | samyak praṇihitaṁ cārthaṁ pr̥ṣṭaḥ san nābhinandati ||

60.1

liṅ saṅ prāgvivāka, huvus(297) tinakvanan(298) mami, lavanta mavyavahāra(299), adya siṅgih karika ujarnya ri kami(300), mavaraha ta kita iri kami, maṅkanā liṅ saṅ(301) prāgvivāka tatan sahur, hana tan eṅət ri(302) hujarnya tambayan(303), hana tatan vruh ri(304) rumuhun kāri(305), ika ta(306) maṅkana kabeh, yatika(307) sorakna vicāranya.

61.

jñātāraḥ santi mety uktvā diśety ukto diśen na yaḥ | dharmasthaḥ kāraṇair etair hīnaṁ tam iti nirdiśet ||

  • The third lemma suggest a difference transmission of the base text:diśety ukto diśen na cet.

61.1

jñātāraḥ(308) santi mety uktvā(309), hana ta(310) vvaṅ makveh sākṣinya, diśeti(311), kinon ta ya mijilakna sākṣinya, na cet(312), tatan vijilakən ya, ika taṅ maṅkana, varahakna yan sor pakṣanya(313), makanimitta salahniṅ kira-kiranya, dharma saṅ(314) prāgvivāka yan maṅkana.

62.

abhiyoktā na ced brūyād vadhyo daṇḍyaś ca dharmataḥ | na cet tripakṣāt prabrūyād dharmaṁ prati parājitaḥ ||
  • MDhŚ08.058
  • The paraphrase suggests that the received reading, instead of vadhyo, was bādhyo, baddhyo or bandhyo, the former two being among the variant readings recorded by Olivelle. The paraphrase also seems to presuppose a reading trisākṣiṇam bruyāt (or the like) instead of tripakṣāt prabruyāt. But no such variant is reported in Olivelle’s edition.

62.1

hana vvaṅ managih-nagih, tinakvanan(315) kāraṇaniṅ pihutaṅnya(316), tatan sumahur kāpit(317), sikəpən(318) yogya daṇḍan ikā, satinagihnya(319) ləpihakna. kunaṅ ikaṅ anagih tan pahujarakna(320), trisākṣi, ndya(321) lvirnya, sākṣi, likhita, bhukti, yogya sorakna vicāranya, de saṅ prāgvivāka.

63.

yo yāvan nihnuvītārthaṁ mithyā yāvati vā vadet | tau nr̥peṇa hy adharmajñau dāpyau taddviguṇaṁ damam ||
  • MDhŚ08.059

63.1

hana vvaṅ haṅas yan pahutaṅ(322), hana vvaṅ managih riṅ tan pahutaṅ(323), ikaṅ aṅas(324) yan pahutaṅ(325), mvaṅ managih riṅ tan pahutaṅ adharma ṅaranya, vruh yan salah ulahnya, haṅas yan pahutaṅ(326), mvaṅ(327) tan tuhv apihutaṅ, ikaṅ vvaṅ maṅkana, yogya ḍaṇḍan(328) kalih, savilaṅikaṅ utaṅnya, kaṅ hinaṅas(329) ləpihakna, ya ḍaṇḍanikaṅ haṅas hutaṅnya, hutaṅ sakurənya ləpiha ya, ikaṅ ləpihniṅ hutaṅnya(330), *pandaṇḍeriya satinagihakən ləpihakna(331), ḍaṇḍanikaṅ anagih riṅ(332) tan pahutaṅ.

64.

pr̥ṣṭo ’pavyayamānas tu kr̥tāvastho dhanaiṣiṇā | tryavaraiḥ sākṣibhir bhāvyo nr̥pabrāhmaṇasaṁnidhau ||

5.

Topic of Witnesses, etc.

66.

gr̥hiṇaḥ putriṇo maulāḥ kṣatraviṭśūdrayonayaḥ | arthyuktāḥ sākṣyam arhanti na ye ke cid anāpadi ||

  • MDhŚ08.149-08.150 Our author seems to have known the first Sanskrit stanza with the reading ādhisīmā. It is unclear whether he knew the second at all — whether the phrases after tan ilaṅa ya still concern the first stanza, whether they are a loose rendering of stanza 150 as we know it, or whether they correspond to a radically different version of that stanza. The use of a lowest-level instead of final punctuation after tan ilaṅa ya in all three manuscripts suggests that the scribes regarded what follows as part of the preceding paraphrase.

takvan LK
We cannot make sense of the text as it is transmitted, with takvan, as we require a passive verb form. There are rather numerous occurrences of takvanana in our text and in others, while takvanən is scarcely attested anywhere, but we favor this emendation as it seems easier to understand how the error takvan ikaṅ might have arisen from takvanən ikaṅ than from takvanana ikaṅ. A further complication lies in the fact that the sequence takvan ikaṅ is attested also in div 28.ikaṅ ulahK

Manuscript L inserts a substantial interpolation between two iterations of the lemma. The interpolation notably contains the full text of MDhŚ 8.139 and an unidentified Sanskrit stanza. Although having stanza 8.139, with paraphrase, in this general part of the text is potentially attractive, the fact that the stanza is quoted in full is suspect, and the precise locus where it is inserted interrupts the paraphrase of 8.137. On these grounds, we favor the hypothesis that the segment of text found only in this witness is extraneous to our text.pirak paṇa sapuluhLK

om. LKM
In order for the arithmetic in this paragraph to work, we absolutely need this sentence to state a quantity of twelve and a half māṣas (i.e., 12 māṣa + 2 kupaṅ). Should we also supply ma before mā? Probably not, as ku in the last sentence is also not preceded by ma. For our author, ma, su seems to have been a fixed combination with ma no longer able freely to be combined with other units, as happens in the epigraphic corpus.2LK

tkaniṁ ṅalaṅanta:raniṁ Ltəkaniṅ aṅalantaraniṁ Mma, su, 9LM
ma:, 1, 9 K6, riṅ sapuluh tahun conj.
A riṁ salek· LKA, riṁ salek· M
The witnesses clearly point to a value of 9 suvarṇas. This means the total number of māṣas in question is at least 144, i.e., a factor of 10 times the annual yield on the loan. For this reason, we conjecture that the number corruptly transmitted as A in all witnesses was a 6, reject the reading riṅ salek despite unanimous manuscript support for it, and conjecture sapuluh tahun. It is not evident why our author would have thought of a ten-year period in the present context, but it may be relevant that this duration will be mentioned explicitly two time not far below (div 130, 132).

Our author seems to have known the first Sanskrit stanza with the reading ādhisīmā. It is unclear whether he knew the second at all — whether the phrases after tan ilaṅa ya still concern the first stanza, whether they are a loose rendering of stanza 150 as we know it, or whether they correspond to a radically different version of that stanza. The use of a lowest-level instead of final punctuation after tan ilaṅa ya in all three manuscripts suggests that the scribes regarded what follows as part of the preceding paraphrase.dravyaniṅLK

aṅgataniṅ Malaṅ-alaṅLK
aṅalaṅ-alaṅi Mśeṣaniṅ tukon … anak putuniṅ ahutaṅ thus formulated in L
śeṣaniṁ ḍaṇḍa, śeṣa vlan·, Ika ta kabeḥ, yan matikaṁ mahutaṁ, tan yogya tagihən hanaknya Ksesa vəlyan, ika ta kabeḥ yan mati kaṁ mahutaṁ, tan yogya tagihən anaknya Msesaniṁ, sesa vəlyan, ika ta kabeḥ yan mati kaṁ mahutaṁ, tan yogya tagihən anaknya Mśeṣaniṅ daṇḍa, śeṣa vlyan, ika ta kabeh, yan matīkaṅ mahutaṅ, tan yogya tagihən hanaknya KM
Paradosis of KM: śeṣaniṅ daṇḍa, śeṣa vlyan, ika ta kabeh, yan matīkaṅ mahutaṅ, tan yogya tagihən hanaknya
The two alternative ways of reading the last sentence, represented respectively by L and KM, seem equally acceptable. It is remarkable that where L reads śeṣaniṅ tukon, KM seem to reflect śeṣa vlyan in their hyparchetype, while they agree with L on reading śeṣaniṅ ḍaṇḍa. There is external textual evidence in Perpusnas L882 (mvah hutaṅ tan kaliliranā deniṅ putra, hutaṅ tan paputra, hutaṅ totohan, śeṣadaṇḍa, hutaṅ tukon, hutaṅ sajə̄ṅ) that might support conjecturing śeṣa ḍaṇḍa in our text. There is also evidence that tukon and vəlyan were felt to be equivalent in this genre of literature UBL Or 5037 (ana vvaṅ istrī linamar saptapayu sinrahan ikaṅ tukon mati taṅ istrīkaṅ sinrahan tukon vəlyan ika si baṅavan ika tan vaṅsulakna ikaṅ tukon).

The appearance of the word sabhā in the sentence supports our conjecture. The similarity of the akṣaras sa to ca and bha to ra seems to underlie an error shared here by all mss.
kunaṅ […] sākṣinya
The readings of both witnesses cannot be reconciled with each other without doing violence to the one or the other. It is noticeable that the reading of K is much more coherent than that of L. By the principle of lectio difficilior potior, L’s’ readings should probably be preferred:they are less consistent, somewhat elliptical, and compressed, whereas K’s readings look like an expansion and systematization. All witnesses read a lowest-level punctuation sign here and after the gloss of the next stanza:it seems that MDhŚ08.154–156 were considered to form a group.ikaikaṁ […] nikaṅ inakuniṅ bapanya panahuranya
This paragraph is transmitted ibn exceedingly corrupt form in all witnesses; we are forced to take recourse to extreme conjectures to obtain a coherent text.loka, sira…loka maṅkana an omission due to eye-skip intervenes in Kṅaranya, limaṅ…ṅaranya, ikaṅ an omission due to eye-skip intervenes in Kliṅ saṅ paṇḍita.…kālavr̥ddhi kārikāvr̥ddhi an omission intervenes in Mpradhana…satuməkanaṅ kalāntaraniṅ an omission intervenes in K

^381 . kunaṅ […] sākṣinya] The readings of both witnesses cannot be reconciled with each other without doing violence to the one or the other. It is noticeable that the reading of K is much more coherent than that of L. By the principle of lectio difficilior potior, L’s’ readings should probably be preferred:they are less consistent, somewhat elliptical, and compressed, whereas K’s readings look like an expansion and systematization. The interpolation notably contains the full text of MDhŚ 8.139 and an unidentified Sanskrit stanza. Although having stanza 8.139, with paraphrase, in this general part of the text is potentially attractive, the fact that the stanza is quoted in full is suspect, and the precise locus where it is inserted interrupts the paraphrase of 8.137. On these grounds, we favor the hypothesis that the segment of text found only in this witness is extraneous to our text.

^692 . 6, riṅ sapuluh tahun] conj., A riṁ salek·LK, A, riṁ salek·M • The witnesses clearly point to a value of 9 suvarṇas. This means the total number of māṣas in question is at least 144, i.e., a factor of 10 times the annual yield on the loan. For this reason, we conjecture that the number corruptly transmitted as A in all witnesses was a 6, reject the reading riṅ salek despite unanimous manuscript support for it, and conjecture sapuluh tahun. It is not evident why our author would have thought of a ten-year period in the present context, but it may be relevant that this duration will be mentioned explicitly two time not far below (div 130, 132).

^867 . śeṣaniṅ tukon … anak putuniṅ ahutaṅ] Thus formulated in L, śeṣaniṁ ḍaṇḍa, śeṣa vlan·, Ika ta kabeḥ, yan matikaṁ mahutaṁ, tan yogya tagihən hanaknyaK, sesa vəlyan, ika ta kabeḥ yan mati kaṁ mahutaṁ, tan yogya tagihən anaknyaM, sesaniṁ, sesa vəlyan, ika ta kabeḥ yan mati kaṁ mahutaṁ, tan yogya tagihən anaknyaM, śeṣaniṅ daṇḍa, śeṣa vlyan, ika ta kabeh, yan matīkaṅ mahutaṅ, tan yogya tagihən hanaknyaKM • Paradosis of KM: śeṣaniṅ daṇḍa, śeṣa vlyan, ika ta kabeh, yan matīkaṅ mahutaṅ, tan yogya tagihən hanaknya • The two alternative ways of reading the last sentence, represented respectively by L and KM, seem equally acceptable. It is remarkable that where L reads śeṣaniṅ tukon, KM seem to reflect śeṣa vlyan in their hyparchetype, while they agree with L on reading śeṣaniṅ ḍaṇḍa. There is external textual evidence in Perpusnas L882 (mvah hutaṅ tan kaliliranā deniṅ putra, hutaṅ tan paputra, hutaṅ totohan, śeṣadaṇḍa, hutaṅ tukon, hutaṅ sajə̄ṅ) that might support conjecturing śeṣa ḍaṇḍa in our text. There is also evidence that tukon and vəlyan were felt to be equivalent in this genre of literature UBL Or 5037 (ana vvaṅ istrī linamar saptapayu sinrahan ikaṅ tukon mati taṅ istrīkaṅ sinrahan tukon vəlyan ika si baṅavan ika tan vaṅsulakna ikaṅ tukon).

Translation

.1

When the king is going to try a case, he should enter the court modestly accompanied by Brahmins and counselors who are experts in policy Now should his Majesty undertake to attend to litigation/affairs of this world, let him take as companions Brahmins who are knowledgeable and study Scripture, and likewise ministers with the wisdom to judge with discernment; with good conduct, he should enter the council.
